name: Staybridge Suites San Francisco Airport

reviews.text: I stayed here a little over a week.
reviews.title: Great for extended stay

reviews.text: No problems.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.text: The grounds are very well kept.
reviews.title: A terrrific place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You could tell a lot of the "residents" were long term. Everyone was very nice and polite.
reviews.title: A perfect suite for a comfortable get away

reviews.text: I am a single woman and I felt safe.
reviews.title: A great stay with the family

reviews.text: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites for 5 nights during a recent family trip to California. I have to say that the Staff and Management there could put on a clinic for other hotels on how to treat their customers. They were fabulous. Every encounter was greeted with a smile and a "can-do" attitude. Whether it was an extra towel, room upgrade, taxi to the airport, or taking out a bag of food for our wait at the airport....nothing was too much to ask. I cant say enough about how accommodating the Staff was. Yes it is about a 20 minute drive to downtown San Francisco, but the BART train station is a 2 minute walk from the hotel if you don't want to drive. As far as value goes, we got a great deal on a 2 bedroom unit with full kitchen...plenty of room for 4 people. Free breakfast every morning was good, and they also have free snacks and wine/beer every Tues-Thurs from around 5pm for a couple hours. Would highly recommend this place as a "home base" for San Fran sightseeing. Only negatives is that the "curb appeal" is not great (who cares, really) and that being so close to the airport you can hear the planes taking off early in the morning on occasion.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay while Visiting San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here to have more room at a lower price. We then took the Bart in each day. This worked out well for our plans. The San Francisco hotels charge for all the extras--internet, breakfast, etc.
reviews.title: Liked the Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel employees were great. Always willing to help us. They gave us advise on what to see in San Francisco. It was nice to have a variety for breakfast each morning.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: The room was good. I liked the suite part with the extra space and tv. We were on the bottom floor. The good part was no stairs...the bad part was we could hear people walking on the stairs early in the morning. They only do light housekeeping so keep that in mind.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: What a value! I would recommend it to any one. Great big clean rooms with all the comforts of home.
reviews.title: The most uncomfortable bed that I've ever slept in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large, but wasnt too fancy. The wireless connection in our room wasnt working, and the staff couldnt help us out with it. Breakfast was included - not bad.
reviews.title: good for the price

reviews.text: I am remiss in writing this. I stayed at the Staybridge Suites for over 2 weeks from end of August through mid-September, half business and half personal. It was perfect for my needs in every way and Lisa, the GM, runs an amazing operation. Her staff know the guests and are constantly trying to help (but not in an intrusive manner). The hotel's location is just fine - very nearby SFO (I had business in Foster City so was back and forth often - easy commute) and there is a great jogging trail behind the hotel (Centenial Way (?) I think it's called). Although I had a rental car, I found it easy and plesant to walk across the street to the strip mall where there is a massive grocery store, Starbucks, nail salons, Best Buy, you name it. And across the road is Tanforan Shops where there is a Target, Barnes and Nobles, etc. All in all, a marvelous stay and again 'Thanks Lisa' for running a superb operation!
reviews.title: A long and very enjoyable stay!

reviews.text: We were in town for a family function and needed a place to accommodate my family (two adults and a teenager) and my sister and two of her young children. This hotel was perfect. We had a two bedroom suite with kitchenette and living room area.
reviews.title: Great hotel in San Francisco area

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and spacious. They have a beautiful outdoor pool which we were unable to take advantage of because it was too cold out, but the boys (ages 4, 10, & 15) did use the mini basketball court one night when we returned to the hotel. They have a basketball at the reception desk.
reviews.title: This is a good place to stay

reviews.text: They have a good breakfast with all the standard breakfast fare - fruit, hard boiled eggs, waffles, two hot dishes that changed daily, donuts, cereal, coffee, tea, milk, juice, soda, etc.
reviews.title: Great place for Bay Area vacation

reviews.text: We travel a lot as a military family, and Staybridge Suites has been the best so far! At this particular location, I loved the value for the extra room we had for a family of 6.
reviews.title: Best Family Hotel with so many services!

reviews.text: The staff is courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Best home away from home

reviews.text: Continental Breakfast was great with make-your-own waffles, fruit, muffins, oats, juice, eggs, cereal, etc.
reviews.title: There's a reason why this property is always rated 5 stars

reviews.text: Free Laundry Service!
reviews.title: Useful amenities for travelling with baby
Gracious and fantastic, as per their tradition
reviews.text: We loved the free hot cocoa at night in the lobby.

aka: Staybridge Suites San Francisco Airport Hotel San Bruno
description: The Staybridge Suites San Francisco Airport hotel is an all-suite property and the perfect place for your next stay or extended stay and a great alternative to a corporate apartment or temporary housing. Each suite has a full kitchen, a separate living room and large desk with free high-speed Internet. Complimentary breakfast buffet is provided to all our guests as well as a complimentary evening guest reception: Sundowner, which is served Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday from 5:30 PM - 7:30 PM. Apart from the standard Staybridge amenities we also offer an outdoor pool, Jacuzzi and sport court.We are a pet friendly hotel, ideal for corporate relocations and conveniently located in the birthplace of biotechnology, only 3 miles from San Francisco airport. We are within reach of the AT & T Park, home of the San Francisco Giants, Chinatown, and BART. We re also within a 20 mile radius of great attractions such as Alcatraz, the Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman s Wharf, and Union Square. Some of our guests choose to stay with us although they might visit nearby universities such as UC Berkley, Stanford University and San Francisco State University.Many of our regular guests visit us due to our close location to shopping and companies such as Genentech, Gap, Toshiba and Kaiser Permanente. Whatever the reason for your travel is, we would love for you to join our Priority Club & stay with us.
